title: Rapper Pras Michel Goes to Jail for Illegal Donations
summary: Rapper Pras Michel, who was part of the famous music group the Fugees, has been sentenced to 14 years in prison. He was found guilty of illegally giving millions of dollars from other countries to help Barack Obama's campaign for president in 2012. This is against the law because it is not allowed to use foreign money in U.S. elections. The case shows how important it is to follow election rules to keep things fair. Pras Michel is a Grammy-winning artist, and this legal trouble has affected his life and career. The judge decided on the sentence after the trial, emphasizing that breaking election laws is a serious crime.

background_read: Pras Michel is a famous rapper from the group the Fugees, known for hit songs. In the United States, election laws say that only U.S. citizens can donate money to political campaigns to keep elections fair. Using money from other countries is illegal because it might let outsiders control who gets elected. This case helps people understand why rules are important in politics.
